verbose_text: Although previous reports indicate a pro synaptogenic function for PKCepsilon in older neurons, we unexpectedly discovered that endogenous PKCepsilon activation in immature neurons restricts dendritic spine number in a temporally regulated manner, in part through the dual phosphorylation of its substrate, the RhoA GEF Ephexin5, at serine residues 107 and 109 (XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY).
evidence: phosphorylation of its substrate, the RhoA GEF Ephexin5, at serine residues 107
